generalInfo:
Ready for an adventure that packs the best of Cuba into just 12 days? This tour is made for those who want to experience the island full-on: from the charming chaos of Havana to the cool mountain air of Topes de Collantes, with postcard beaches, tobacco valleys, and cities frozen in time along the way.
With a chill guide by your side the whole trip, it’s zero stress and 100% good vibes. You’ll meet locals, dance till sunrise, taste amazing food, and snap pics that’ll blow up your Insta.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Cuba! You’ve just touched down in Havana, the island’s buzzing capital where vintage motors, salsa rhythms and colonial charm all collide. No airport transfer today, so grab a cab or hitch a ride with fellow travellers—your adventure kicks off now. If you fancy a private transfer, just give us a shout and we’ll sort it.

Rise and shine! After breakfast, you’re off in a comfy private transfer to Viñales—a chilled-out town surrounded by lush nature and tobacco fields. The journey’s scenic, the views are cracking, and your guide’s full of stories to keep things fun. Once there, hop on a horse and explore the valley like a proper Cuban cowboy. No experience needed—just good vibes and a sense of adventure. Dinner’s at Finca "El Paraiso", an organic farm where most of what’s on your plate is grown right there. Think fresh veg, local flavours and a sunset that’ll make you forget your phone exists.

Beach day! You’re off to Cayo Jutías, one of Cuba’s hidden gems with crystal-clear waters, white sand and laid-back vibes. Round-trip transport is sorted—just bring your sunnies, swimmers and good energy. It’s about 1.5 hours each way, with loads of time to soak up the sun. Heads up: meals aren’t included, but there are beach shacks serving snacks and coconuts. Or pack a picnic and claim your spot in paradise. In the afternoon back to Viñales just in time for a shower and maybe a sunset mojito.

Pack your bags and wave goodbye to the valley—today you’re heading east to Varadero, one of Cuba’s top beach spots. Think turquoise waters, endless white sand and that perfect mix of chill and fun. You’ll cruise through the countryside with your guide, maybe stopping for a snack or a photo. It’s a long ride, but totally worth it. Once you arrive, kick off your shoes and dive into beach mode. Whether you’re sunbathing, swimming or sipping something cold by the shore, this is your time to unwind.
From sunrise, the beach is calling. Chill on a lounger, play some volleyball or dive into the sea like there’s no tomorrow. Varadero’s not just a beach—it’s energy, laughter and memories that stick.

Time to hit the road! After breakfast, your private transfer takes you towards Trinidad, with a legendary stop in Santa Clara. This city’s full of history and heart—you’ll feel it straight away. Main highlight: Che Guevara’s Mausoleum. Explore the museum and pay tribute to one of Cuba’s most iconic revolutionaries. After lunch, continue south to Trinidad, a colourful colonial town with cobbled streets and salsa rhythms.

Lace up your trainers—it’s nature time! Today’s a round-trip adventure to the lush mountains of Topes de Collantes. The big moment? A hike to Vegas Grandes waterfall, winding through tropical forest, coffee farms and wild orchids. Cool off in natural pools and snap some epic pics. After the trek, tuck into a tasty lunch at a rustic spot surrounded by greenery. Back to Trinidad in the afternoon, full of fresh air, good vibes and maybe a few sore muscles—but totally worth it.

This day is all about soaking up the good life. In the morning, you’ve got options: head to Playa Ancón for soft sand and clear water, or stay in Trinidad and explore the colourful streets, shop for handmade bits and chill in cosy cafés. Lunch idea: La Mar Restaurant—fresh seafood and laid-back vibes. In the afternoon hop on a catamaran for a sunset cruise to Cayo Blanco. Picture this: sailing across turquoise waters, music playing, sun dipping low, sky turning gold and pink. Pure magic.

Buckle up! Today’s a scenic ride from Trinidad to Playa Larga, with Xavier—your top-notch driver who knows every twist and hidden gem. Once you arrive, settle into Hostal Sol y Caribe, a beachside casa where the sea breeze greets you at the door. As the sun sets, enjoy a seafood dinner right by the beach—fresh catch and salty air. Playa Larga is all about laid-back magic.

Morning is yours to finish anything you missed yesterday. After a light lunch, you’ll head back to Havana, aiming to arrive late afternoon. Evening’s free—rest up or sip mojitos on a terrace in Old Havana, surrounded by music, laughter and timeless charm.

Wake up in Havana and head out for a full city tour. Start with a two-hour ride in classic vintage cars through Vedado, Miramar and along the iconic Malecón. Stop at Plaza de la Revolución, then visit Fusterlandia—a mosaic-filled neighbourhood bursting with colour and creativity. After lunch (not included), explore Old Havana on foot. Wander through its four main squares, soak up the colonial charm and street life, and dive into the city’s rich history.
Last day in Havana. Take it easy—pack up, grab a coffee or sneak in one final stroll. When it’s time, head to the airport with your bags full of memories (and maybe a few cheeky souvenirs).
